channel.title: Battlescape Isle
channel.description:
Today I began really coding the Battlescape Source for the first time!
I started by removing errors and everything, so now I have one small problem...
Battlescape Isle requires the correct client, and since I have the first Battlescape Isle client, it only has the ".class" files, cache, and sound media files...
I need to know how to decompile the the .class files into .java files, I have been searching for how to do it all night, and so far nothing
Server Side:
loging in and out - 100% Walking without a disconnection - 60% (you disconnect after a while cause your not on the client) Correct int's - 100% (I had to fix some because they were pointing to auto disconnect) Clean the files - 70% (I just started cleaning up files and editing them for many reasons)
Client side:
Class files - 100% Cache files - 100% Sound Files - 100% Java Files - 0%
The main reason I am bringing back Battlescape is because it is the most stable source, It is a winterlove source yes, yet it is very stable.
I also like the fact that when Battlescape was around there was lots of pkers, yeah...pkers...
Im going to upload a video for you guys soon, so yeah...just sit tight for a few hours!

item.title: Battlescape Isle
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

Umah:

I think to fix the certain client thing, open up server.java, search “int UID = inStream.readDWord();”, and delete that. Then search: “if (UID” , and delete that statement, then save n compile, try it out

Pali coded with mySQL basically you look for this “i_16_”

then you delete that, thats just fixing the loading from mySQL and stuff, but then you gotta fix autospawn, npc’s having hp, ect…

Read full topic

item.title: Battlescape Isle
item.dc:creator: @wolfs_goal wolfs goal
item.description:
@wolfs_goal wrote:

Today I began really coding the Battlescape Source for the first time!

I started by removing errors and everything, so now I have one small problem…

Battlescape Isle requires the correct client, and since I have the first Battlescape Isle client, it only has the “.class” files, cache, and sound media files…

I need to know how to decompile the the .class files into .java files, I have been searching for how to do it all night, and so far nothing

Server Side:

loging in and out - 100%
Walking without a disconnection - 60% (you disconnect after a while cause your not on the client)
Correct int’s - 100% (I had to fix some because they were pointing to auto disconnect)
Clean the files - 70% (I just started cleaning up files and editing them for many reasons)

Client side:

Class files - 100%
Cache files - 100%
Sound Files - 100%
Java Files - 0%

The main reason I am bringing back Battlescape is because it is the most stable source, It is a winterlove source yes, yet it is very stable.

I also like the fact that when Battlescape was around there was lots of pkers, yeah…pkers…

Im going to upload a video for you guys soon, so yeah…just sit tight for a few hours!
